summary: Daniel D. Dietrick, M.D., was found to have provided professional services while under the influence of alcohol on August 28, 2023, exhibiting unprofessional conduct and professional incompetence after testing positive for an elevated blood alcohol level following a procedure. The Maryland State Board of Physicians reprimanded him and suspended his license for a minimum of nine months, requiring enrollment in the Maryland Professional Rehabilitation Program and completion of a professionalism course.
